Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="Width" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Height" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="BitsPerPixel" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

<template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="Width" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Height" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="BitsPerPixel" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message: Video bit transfer rate is %1 bytes per ms.
Boot library accessed file %2 on Device %1. Read %3 bytes and wrote %4 bytes.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceID" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="BytesRead" inType="win:UInt64" outType="xs:unsignedLong"/> <data name="BytesWritten" inType="win:UInt64" outType="xs:unsignedLong"/> </template>

Event.Message: File IO for boot application %1: Total Bytes Read = %2, Total Bytes Written = %3.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="ApplicationGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="BytesRead" inType="win:UInt64" outType="xs:unsignedLong"/> <data name="BytesWritten" inType="win:UInt64" outType="xs:unsignedLong"/> </template>

Event.Message: Image %1 failed IntegrityCheck reason is %3. Image flags are %2. Error ignored due to debugger %4.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="ImageName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ImageFlags" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="Reason" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="ErrorIgnored" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> </template>

Event.Message: A device (%1) that was enumerated by the BIOS was inaccessible to the boot environment.
The system firmware has allocated a memory region previously determined to be unreliable. This has the potential to cause system instability and/or data corruption.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FwStartPage" inType="win:UInt64" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="FwPageCount" inType="win:UInt64" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="FwMemoryType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="FwMemoryAttributes" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="BlStartPage" inType="win:UInt64" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="BlPageCount" inType="win:UInt64" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="BlMemoryType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="BlMemoryAttributes" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> </template>
